default: (a) a {@item longsword|phb}, (b) a {@item rapier|phb}, (c) a {@item shortsword|phb}, (d) a {@item warhammer|phb} or (e) any {@filter simple melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=sand}
(a) a {@item hand crossbow|phb} and 20 bolts or (b) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and 20 bolts
(a) {@item leather armor|phb}, (b) {@item scale mail|phb} or (c) {@item chain mail|phb} (if proficient)
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item scholar's pack|phb}
a {@item holy symbol|phb}, inquisitorial symbol of office and a {@item dagger|phb|dagger}

fluff.name: Inquisitor
entries: Grim and determined, the inquisitor roots out enemies of all kinds, using trickery and guile when righteousness and purity is not enough. Although inquisitors can be dedicated to particular deities as a clandestine part of the formal religious order, some simply follow their own sense of justice and are more than willing to take the most extreme measures to make sure justice, divine or not, is served.

Inquisitors tend to move from place to place, chasing down enemies and researching emerging threats. As a result, they often travel with others, if for no other reason than to mask their presence. Religious inquisitors may work with members of their faith whenever they can, but even such allies are not above suspicion as no one is truly innocent.

entries.name: Creating A Inquisitor
entries: An inquisitor's life is a harsh one, short on trust and forever engaging in a game of cat and mouse. How did you enter into such a life? Did your piety for your faith lead you to root out heretics and sinners? Were you assigned such a role in a time of great peril for your order? Or are you simply possessed of an unflinching moral backbone and could no longer stand the corrupt world you see around you?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make an inquisitor quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Wisdom your highest ability score. Second, depending on what fighting style you want to use, choose either Strength or Dexterity. Third, choose the acolyte background.

entries.name: Inquisitor Multiclassing
entries: Should you wish to multiclass into an inquisitor, the prerequisites and proficiencies gained are listed below.

entries.name: Ability Score Minimum
entries: Strength 13 or Dexterity 13, and Wisdom 13

entries.name: Proficiencies Gained
entries: Light armor, medium armor, simple weapons.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order
entries: Pick from one of three orders, each of which focuses on hunting one particular type of foe and gives you features at 1st, 3rd, 6th, 10th, 15th and 18th levels.

classFeature.name: Judgement
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can pronounce judgement upon your foes as a bonus action. Starting when the judgement is made, you receive a bonus or special ability based on the type of judgement.
At 1st level you gain one use of this feature, at 9th level you can use this feature twice and three times at 17th level. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Once activated this ability lasts for 1 minute, after which all of the bonuses immediately end; if you activate a different judgement whilst one is already active the bonuses from the first judgement end.
When you use this ability, you must select one type of judgement to make:

entries.name: Destruction
entries: You are filled with divine wrath, gaining a +1 bonus on all weapon damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and to +3 at 17th level.

entries.name: Healing
entries: You are surrounded by a healing light, causing you to heal 2 hit points each at the start of your turns as long as you have at least 1 hit point and are not {@condition unconscious}. The amount of healing increases to 4 hit points at 9th level and 6 hit points at 17th level.

entries.name: Justice
entries: This judgement spurs you to seek justice, granting a +1 bonus on all weapon attack rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and to +3 at 17th level.

entries.name: Piercing
entries: This judgement gives you great focus and makes your spells more potent. You gain a +1 bonus on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells and on spell attack rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and to +3 at 17th level. At 9th level whilst this judgement is active, creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against your spells.

entries.name: Protection
entries: You are surrounded by a protective aura, granting a +1 bonus to your Armor Class. At 9th level, this bonus is increased to +2.

entries.name: Purity
entries: You are protected from the vile taint of your foes, gaining a +1 bonus on all saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level and to +3 at 17th level.

entries.name: Resiliency
entries: This judgement makes you feel more resilient, gaining 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier in temporary hitpoints. At 9th level, you gain double the temporary hitpoints you roll.

entries.name: Resistance
entries: You are shielded by a flickering aura, gaining resistance against one of the following types of damage: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder. At 9th level if you already have resistance to the type you choose you gain immunity instead.

entries.name: Smiting
entries: This judgement bathes your weapons in a divine light. While held by you, your weapons count as magic for the purposes of overcoming resistances and immunities; additionally at 9th level your weapon treats immunity as resistance whilst the judgement is active.

classFeature.name: Optional Feature: Retinue
entries: If your DM allows it, starting at 1st level you may employ a small retinue of followers.

Choose from the following list (duplicates allowed): {@creature Acolyte|MM}, {@creature Commoner|MM}, {@creature Druid|MM}, {@creature Guard|MM}, {@creature Knight|MM}, {@creature Noble|MM}, {@creature Priest|MM}, {@creature Scout|MM}, {@creature Spy|MM}, {@creature Thug|MM}, {@creature Tribal Warrior|MM}, and {@creature Veteran|MM}. You can only make choices up to the maximum CR/limit for your level.
Each follower has a salary of 10gp x CR a day (minimum 1gp) and they are controlled by the DM, but follow your orders as long as they're not outright suicidal.

The method by which you hire your retinue will be determined by your DM. They could be with you from the start, hired via a recruitment notice, hired from NPCs you meet in your travels or however else your DM sees fit.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: An event in your past, or in the life of a parent or ancestor, left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with arcane magic. This font of magic, with careful meditation and practice, fuels your spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 2nd level, you know one cantrip of your choice from the inquisitor spell list. You learn additional inquisitor cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Inquisitor table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Inquisitor table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter inquisitor spells|spells|class=inquisitor} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these inquisitor spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell shield|phb} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell shield|phb} using either slot.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: You prepare the list of inquisitor spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the inquisitor spell list. When you do so, choose a number of inquisitor spells equal to the Prepared Spells column of the Inquisitor table. The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of inquisitor spells requires time spent in practice and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your inquisitor spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a inquisitor spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use your inquisitorial symbol of office and/or your holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for your inquisitor spells.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Judgement (two uses)
entries: At 9th level, you gain a second use of your judgement feature.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Cunning Initiative
entries: At 11th level using your wits and experience with battle, you can add your Wisdom modifier to your initiative rolls in addition to your Dexterity modifier.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Expert Interrogator
entries: At 14th level your formidable reputation precedes you and barely anyone can withstand your scrutiny.

You gain proficiency in {@skill Insight}, {@skill Intimidation} and {@skill Investigation} skills; if you are already proficient in one of those skills then your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with that skill.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Judgement (three uses)
entries: At 17th level, you gain a second use of your judgement feature.

classFeature.name: Inquisitorial Order Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inquisitorial Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Final Judgement
entries: At 20th level you can, as an action, present your holy symbol and speak a final judgement upon a foe. Choose one creature within 15 feet of you, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. If it fails, it is reduced to 0 hit points. If it succeeds, it takes {@damage 10d10} psychic damage.
You regain the use of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Daemon Hunters
entries: An order of inquisitors dedicated to hunting errant "daemons", their collective term for celestials, fey, and fiends, the members of this order track down and slay any such daemon that dabbles maliciously in mortal affairs.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Daemon Hunter Order Spells
rows: {@spell bless}, {@spell ceremony|xge}, {@spell sacred flame}, {@spell word of radiance|xge}
{@spell aura of life}, {@spell shadow of moil|xge}
{@spell dispel evil and good}, {@spell wall of light|xge}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with all martial weapons, shields and heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Forceful Smite
entries: Starting when you join this order, you're able to strike your weapons against your sworn foes with especially malicious force.

Whenever you hit a celestial, fey or fiend with a weapon that you're proficient with and deal damage, you deal an amount of additional force damage based on your level in this class, your attacks deal 1d4 force damage at 1st level, 2d4 at 10th level, and 3d4 at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis Ward
entries: Starting at 3rd level you learn to protect yourself from the insidious attacks of your foes. You gain a number of uses of this feature equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) and can expend 1 use to gain advantage on a saving throw you are required to make. You regain all expended uses of this feature after finishing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Grimoire of True Names
entries: At 6th level you gain access to a Grimoire of True Names, a book containing the collected true names of each celestial, fey and fiend encountered by daemon hunting inquisitors.

As an action you may choose a single celestial, fey, or fiend you can see and that is within earshot and speak aloud their true name. Make an Intelligence (History) check with a DC equal to 13 or the creature's CR (which ever is higher), on a successful roll the chosen creature takes 8d8 necrotic or radiant damage (your choice).

You have advantage on the history check if you have used this creature's true name before. You gain a number of uses of this feature equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses of this feature after finishing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Baneful Aura
entries: Starting at 10th level your presence has become a bane to your foes, all celestials, fey, and fiends within 15 feet of you have disadvantage on all saving throws.

Additionally you can choose a number of creatures in range that aren't celestials, fey, or fiends up to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), the chosen creatures must succeed a Wisdom save against your spell save DC or have disadvantage on all saving throws whilst within 15 feet of you. On a success the creature is immune to your baneful aura for 24 hours.
Once you've used your aura in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can use it in this way again.

subclassFeature.name: Strike True
entries: At 15th level you've fought your foes for so long you can predict their defence and break through it with an ease born of experience. You can use your bonus action to gain advantage on attacks against celestials, fey and fiends.

subclassFeature.name: Unfaltering Determination
entries: At 18th level none can stand against your will, none can cause you to falter and none can twist you to their schemes. You become immune to being charmed, frightened and stunned.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Witch Hunters
entries: The bane of mages across the land, this order of inquisitors hunts down and slays rogue spellcasters; using their esoteric abilities to shrug off magic with disturbing ease.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Witch Hunter Order Spells
rows: {@spell absorb elements|xge}, {@spell control flames|xge}, {@spell create bonfire|xge}, {@spell detect magic}
{@spell aura of purity}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Spell Disruption
entries: When you join this order you learn how to counteract the foul machinations of rogue spellcasters. As a reaction to a creature casting a spell within 30 feet of you, you can attempt to stop the spell from being cast.

You declare a spell slot level and roll a Wisdom check against the spellcaster's spell save DC. On a successful roll the spell is stopped, but on a failure the spell continues and your spell slot is still used. The disruption fails automatically if the slot you choose is a lower level than the one used to cast the spell. You may attempt to dispel cantrips without expending a spell slot.
At 10th level the range for this ability increases to 45 feet and it increases again to 60 feet at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Piercing Gaze
entries: Starting at 3rd level few can withstand your scrutiny for long, you gain advantage on checks to see invisible creatures and to determine illusions.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Backlash
entries: Beginning at 6th level your magic disruption sends a surge of energy back into the caster's mind.

When you successfully use your spell disruption feature to stop a spell the creature takes a number of d8 equal to the spell's level in psychic damage; on an unsuccessful roll the creature takes half as much psychic damage (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Magic Absorption
entries: At 10th level you have built up a bulwark against foul sorcery; you have resistance to damage from spells.

subclassFeature.name: Oculum Arcanis
entries: At 15th level you gain access to an oculum arcanis, a mystic seeing device. When you make your first attack roll against a creature who can cast spells within 30 feet of you on your turn, you do so with advantage.

Additionally you may use your oculum arcanis to gain 30 feet of true sight for 1 hour; if you do so, you no longer have advantage on your attacks against spellcasting creatures until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hexagrammic Wards
entries: At 18th level you learn how to cast powerful wards that can shield you or your allies from harm. As a action you may choose one creature you can see within 15 feet of you (which may include yourself), that creature gains immunity to damage from magical weapon attacks and damage from spells until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Xeno Hunters
entries: Expert hunters adept at tracking and taking down all manner of foul and warped creatures, the inquisitors of this order are invaluable when fighting beastly threats.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Xeno Hunter Order Spells
rows: {@spell detect poison and disease}, {@spell gust|xge}, {@spell hunter's mark}, {@spell shape water|xge}

subclassFeature.name: Preferred Prey
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy.

Choose a type of preferred prey: aberrations, beasts, dragons, elementals, giants, monstrosities, oozes or plants. Alternatively, you can select two races of humanoid (such as gnolls and orcs) as preferred prey.
You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track your preferred prey, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

subclassFeature.name: Know Your Quarry
entries: At 3rd level you can use your bonus action to make a DC 10 Nature check to recall information about a creature type you chose in your preferred prey feature, gaining advantage on saving throws against their weapon and spell attacks for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Pinning Strike
entries: Starting at 6th level you learn how to efficiently trap your prey, holding them in place for you to strike. Using your action, choose a large or smaller creature up to 60 feet away from you and make a melee attack roll if you're within range or a ranged attack if the creature is within your weapon's short range.
On a hit the creature must succeed a Strength saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your attack's ability score modifier or become restrained until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Predator's Knowledge
entries: Starting at 10th level you apply your practical experience in the field to enhance your attacks. You add half your wisdom modifier (rounded down, minimum of 1) to attack and damage rolls against the type of creatures you've chosen for your preferred prey feature. At 15th level you add your full wisdom modifier to attack and damage rolls.
Additionally you can choose another type of preferred prey from the list in that class feature or you can select two races of humanoids.

subclassFeature.name: Stamina Siphon
entries: At 15th level you can siphon the stamina of your foes to learn their weaknesses. You can use your action to target a creature within 30 feet of you, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC.
On a failed save they suffer 1 level of exhaustion and you gain advantage on attacks against creatures of the same type as the one siphoned on your next turn.
You regain the use of this feature once you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Veteran of the Long Hunt
entries: After so long chasing your quarry, you know just how to break their guard. At 18th level you gain advantage on attack rolls against the type of creatures you've chosen for your preferred prey feature when you use the know your quarry feature.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Grave Wardens
entries: Inquisitors of this order, as the name may suggest, preserve the sanctity of life by rooting out and destroying the creatures of the undead; from the lowliest vampire to the most ancient lich, none escape their watch.
At each indicated inquisitor level, add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

entries.caption: Grave Warden Order Spells
rows: {@spell ceremony|xge}, {@spell chill touch}, {@spell create or destroy water}, {@spell green-flame blade|TCE}

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: When you join this order you learn how to arm yourself to better fight the creatures of the undead. You gain proficiency with {@item heavy crossbow|PHB|heavy crossbows}, as well as {@item Woodcarver's Tools|PHB} and may spend 1 hour using the tools with a small supply of wood to craft a wooden stake.
A wooden stake is a simple melee weapon with the light and thrown (20/60) properties, on a hit it deals {@dice 1d4} piercing damage.

You may also create {@item Holy Water (flask)|PHB|holy water} by performing a special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires you to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Spurn Death's Touch
entries: Members of this order are typically chosen from those with impressive mental fortitude in the face of undeath.
At 3rd level whenever you must make a Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw against a spell or effect from an undead creature, you gain advantage on the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Turn Undead
entries: Starting at 3rd level as an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.
You can use this feature once, and may use it twice at 15th level. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain your expended uses.

subclassFeature.name: Mortal Respite
entries: At 6th level you learn sacred rites that can impede an undead assault for a brief time. As an action you present your holy symbol and do one of the following:

entries.name: Calm the Soul
entries: Choose a number of undead creatures you can see within 30 feet equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). A target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The {@condition charmed} creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the effect ends, the creature knows it was {@condition charmed} by you.

entries.name: Stillness of the Grave
entries: Choose a number of undead creatures you can see within 30 feet equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). A target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute and fall prone. At the end of each of its turns, a target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the {@condition paralyzed} condition ends on the target.
You regain the use of this feature once you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Warden's Vigilance
entries: At 10th level you understand how to efficiently combat several varieties of undead, and gain the following benefits:
You are immune to being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by undead creatures.
If you reduce a creature with the Undead Fortitude trait to 0 hit points with a melee attack, ranged attack or a spell, the trait does not function and the creature dies.
Once per turn when you hit an undead creature that has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, your attack ignores that resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Final Death
entries: At 15th level you are able to prevent undead from returning or new undead being created with your killing blows.
Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, ranged attack or a spell, the creature can't become undead by any means short of a wish spell for the next 7 days.
If the creature is already undead and of CR 15 or lower, it is instantly destroyed instead.

subclassFeature.name: Positive Energy Burst
entries: At 18th level you can emit of a burst of positive energy as an action. Each undead creature within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC; they take {@damage 10d6} radiant damage on failed save and half as much on a successful one.
You regain the use of this feature once you have finished a long rest.

subclass.name: Xeno Hunter
subclassFeatures: Order of the Xeno Hunters|Inquisitor|FoxfireInquisitor|Xeno Hunter|FoxfireInquisitor|1
Veteran of the Long Hunt|Inquisitor|FoxfireInquisitor|Xeno Hunter|FoxfireInquisitor|18
